diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute Cholecystitis, perforated gallbladder, urinary retention
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's recurrent symptoms of RUQ pain, the presence of cholelithiasis on imaging, leukocytosis, and ultrasound findings of irregular gallbladder wall contour with pericholecystic fluid supported the diagnosis of acute cholecystitis and perforated gallbladder.
